results.title: Call of the home village = Xiang qing
results.creator_credit: Pearl River Film Studio, Bingliu Hu and Jin Wang
results.brief_description:
Qiuyue’s adopted son, Tiangui is going to marry her daughter, Cuicui. But Tiangui’s biological parents have now learnt where their estranged son is and are against the marriage. Qiuyue sends Tiangui back to his parents, who joined the revolution in the early years and are now senior officials living in the city. Tiangui’s mother is excited to see her son and arrange everything for him to begin a new life. Tiangui is not comfortable with the easy life and misses his foster mum and fiancée in the country. Tiangui’s mother tries all means to prevent her son going back, and she wants Tiangui to marry the daughter of a colleague. Noticing the problem, Tiangui’s father blames his wife and asks Tiangui to invite Qiuyue and Cuicui to their home. However, Tiangui’s mother sends a letter to Qiuyue, telling her that only Cuicui is invited. Tiangui would not go without Qiuyue, and Qiuyue eventually compromises. At Tiangui’s home, Qiuyue accidentally finds out that Tiangui’s parents are the couple that she saved years ago. She did not tell the truth to her children but chose to leave without letting anybody know.

Similar to The Green Mountain of Bamboo (1982), this film also deals with young people’s free love. Traditionally in China, a couple’s marriage would be arranged by their parents. Very often, the couple would have no chance to meet with each other before their wedding day. Arranged marriage is regarded as a “feudal concept” and thus criticized by the CCP. Produced in the early 1980s, this film delivers a message to the audience that CCP members must not be corrupted by feudal ideas. (2 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Call of the country
results.creator_credit: James Cook University and Melanie Guiney
results.brief_description: On remote Cape York Peninsula, the Pormpuraaw Aboriginal Community and scientists from the Anthropology and Geography departments of James Cook University are joining together to map the cultural, ecological and environmental heritage of their country. For many of the custodians it is their first trip home for many years and represents the renewal of an old and intimate relationship with the land. Through this bringing together of ancient understanding and modern methods it is hoped to preserve the past for the protection of the future.

results.title: Call it...rehabilitation
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: The story of how an imaginary Canadian community might coordinate its resources, with federal and provincial government aid, to provide full rehabilitation services for its disabled citizens. The film follows a local doctor’s dream of community organization in which existing agencies are brought together into a cooperative plan whereby persons disabled by accident or disease may be restored to useful, productive places in their community.

results.title: Call it murder = Midnight
results.brief_description: A decision (and ensuing conviction that all murderers are subject to capital punishment) to sentence a woman to death for a crime of passion comes back to haunt jury foreman Edward Weldon (O.P. Heggie), when he has a personal stake in a capital punishment trial. Weldon’s daughter, Stella (Sidney Fox) kills a former lover who betrayed her, challenging her father’s assumption that all murderers deserve the ultimate punishment, and all on the eve of the execution of the woman he helped sway the jury to send to the electric chair. Humphrey Bogart plays a brief but memorable role as one of the murder victims. Cast also includes Granville Bates and Helen Flint.

results.title: Call It Murder
results.brief_description: A jury foreman is persecuted by the press, and even his family, after sending a woman to the electric chair. Stars Humphrey Bogart. Originally released as “Midnight”. Rated: PG

results.title: Call it courage
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A South Seas youth attempts to overcome his fear of the sea by sailing beyond the security of his island’s barrier reef. For young Mafatu, this simple trip becomes both a journey into peril, and a journey into manhood. Based on the novel of same title by Armstrong Sperry.

results.title: Call her sausage
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Gus Meins
results.brief_description: Ben proves to be the undoing when Billy opens a new deli. Ben and Billy do a variation of the famous “who’s on first” skit. A Taxi Boys’ comedy starring Billy Gilbert, Ben Blue, Lucile Browne, Billy Bletcher.

results.title: Call for order
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage two essentials to an efficient office— tidiness and cleanliness. An office which in the first place is badly designed, and then is littered with superfluous or redundant furniture, articles of clothing, over-flowing waste-paper baskets, stacks of files piled high on desks and tea cups and tea-making equipment, cannot possibly function efficiently, quite apart from being unpleasant to work in. The film offers suggestions aimed at keeping offices clean and tidy, thereby increasing efficiency and saving time, trouble and temper.

results.title: Call an ambulance
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: A social studies film outlining the work of Civil Ambulance organisations in an Australian capital city. At all times the specially trained ambulance officers must be ready to answer accident and hospital calls in any part of the city. Ambulance men are seen working in co-operation with a Boy Scout group, in the discovery and rescue of an injured man in an isolated country area.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Ray Stark, Columbia Films and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.
